p: The viral agents (RVFV and FMDV) were more prevalent than the bacterial agents ( Brucella spp. and C. abortus) in single and multiple patterns. Species susceptibility, locality, source, age, and gender had an impact on the prevalence rates. Brucella abortus and B. melitensis were reported among the human population with a higher prevalence among males and old aged patients. Finding a link between human health and pathogens that circulate in domestic ruminants in Medina will help us to deal with such serious conditions.
